message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "This report presents an analysis of the relationship between household consumption and income using data from the World Bank's Living Standards Measurement Study (LSMS).", "dataset": ["World Bank's Living Standards Measurement Study (LSMS)"], "topic": ["Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "We analyze data from the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) to explore the impact of climate change on global crop yields.", "dataset": ["Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "Using survey data from the World Health Organization (WHO), we study the determinants of access to affordable healthcare in low- and middle-income countries.", "dataset": ["World Health Organization (WHO)"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This study investigates the relationship between social capital and economic growth using cross-country data from the World Values Survey (WVS) and the International Social Survey Programme (ISSP).", "dataset": ["World Values Survey (WVS)", "International Social Survey Programme (ISSP)"], "topic": ["Governance", "Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "Drawing on data from the International Monetary Fund's (IMF) World Economic Outlook database, we quantify the macroeconomic effects of public investment in infrastructure.", "dataset": ["International Monetary Fund's (IMF) World Economic Outlook database"], "topic": ["Infrastructure", "Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "We combine time-use data from the American Time Use Survey (ATUS) and energy consumption data from the Residential Energy Consumption Survey (RECS) to estimate the elasticity of substitution between energy and leisure.", "dataset": ["American Time Use Survey (ATUS)", "Residential Energy Consumption Survey (RECS)"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "In this paper, we analyze public procurement data from the World Bank's e-Procurement platform to explore the determinants of corruption in public procurement.", "dataset": ["World Bank's e-Procurement platform"], "topic": ["Governance"]}, {"sentence": "We use a dataset that combines information on household wealth from the Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) and the Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys (MICS) to examine the relationship between economic inequality and child malnutrition in Sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS)", "Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys (MICS)"], "topic": ["Inequality and Shared Prosperity", "Nutrition"]}, {"sentence": "This study uses data on regulatory quality from the World Bank's Doing Business database and trade data from the United Nations Conference on Trade and Development (UNCTAD) to assess the impact of regulation on trade.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Doing Business database", "United Nations Conference on Trade and Development (UNCTAD)"], "topic": ["Trade", "Governance"]}, {"sentence": "We combine data on natural disasters from the Dartmouth Flood Observatory with data on poverty from the World Bank's Poverty and Shared Prosperity database to investigate the effects of disasters on poverty reduction efforts.", "dataset": ["Dartmouth Flood Observatory", "World Bank's Poverty and Shared Prosperity database"], "topic": ["Disaster Risk Management", "Poverty"]}]
